meanings.definition: A person or group of people who are charged with a crime or offense.
meanings.sent1: The accused stood silently in the courtroom.
meanings.sent2: The accused were brought before the judge for questioning.
meanings.sent3: The accused shared a nervous glance with their lawyer.
meanings.sent4: The accused were like trapped birds in the legal system.
meanings.sent5: The accused faces the harsh reality of the accusations.

meanings.definition: To charge someone with an offense or crime.
meanings.sent1: The police accused the suspect of theft.
meanings.sent2: She accused him of breaking the vase.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully accused the dog of stealing its toy.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds accused the sky of hiding the sun.
meanings.sent5: The teacher accused the student of cheating on the test.
